titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alaska Manuscripts Collection
titlestmt.author: by Alison Clemens

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 20, 2019 at 03:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: This collection encompasses accessions of single letters and small groups of letters and other manuscripts pertaining to the history of Alaska, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Letters and documents discuss travel in Alaska, interactions with Native Alaskans, the Alaska gold rush, the fur industry, surveying, business operations, and naval service. Also includes one photograph of the U.S.S. Pinta.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Source information is recorded in the finding aid. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Alaska Manuscripts Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alaska Manuscripts Collection. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection encompasses accessions of single letters and small groups of letters and other manuscripts pertaining to the history of Alaska, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Letters and documents discuss travel in Alaska, interactions with Native Alaskans, the Alaska gold rush, the fur industry, surveying, business operations, and naval service. Also includes one photograph of the U.S.S. Pinta.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by creator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript diary concerning the Alaska gold rush.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Charles Apfelbaum on the Library Associates Fund, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two manuscript letters by and to Emmons concerning naval service in Sitka, Alaska, on on the U.S.S. Pinta. Also includes a photograph of the U.S.S. Pinta.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven autograph letters, signed, from Everette to Nelson A. Miles concerning travel with Native Alaskans to Juneau and Chilcat, Alaska, and rations of gold and supplies used on the trip.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Argonaut Book Shop on the Walter McClintock Memorial Fund, 1960.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six autograph letters, signed, from George to William Easton concerning travel to Alaska, surveying, and gold prospects.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William P. Wreden on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 1987.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a typescript diary of a 1915 trip to Alaska.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript letters and documents by Howard and others concerning Howard's tour of duty in Alaska.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from J. E. Reynolds on the William Robertson Coe Fund No. 3, 1966.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript account book for an unidentified business in Nome, Alaska.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Vigilante Rare Documents on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph letter, signed, congratulating C. H. Peirer on an unidentified accomplishment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Carnegie Bookshop Inc. on the Winlock William Miller, Jr. Memorial Fund, 1957.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two documents by unidentified authors concerning trade in Alaska. Includes one manuscript document in an unidentified hand concerning the fur trade and travel in Alaska, and one typescript document in Russian concerning Alaska wildlife and forestation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The fur trade and travel manuscript was a gift of Charles and Lindley Eberstadt, 1970.
The Alaskan wildlife typescript is from an unknown sourcen.
